Nothing new plot-wise, it's predictable and Wraps up as expected but I still cried.
Will be recommending it to my friends who are looking for family films about God's love. (Actor, Director) Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Ross Poldark rides again in a swashbuckling new adaptation of the hit series that helped launch MASTERPIECE in the 1970s. Aidan Turner (The Hobbit) stars as Captain Poldark, who returns to Cornwall after the American Revolution to find that his fighting days are far from over. Feeling betrayed by everything he loves, Ross must rebuild his life, embarking on a risky business venture and finding love where he least expects it. This set is the complete First Season.', 'Review', "Sweeping, Stirring, Rousing, Lush. --Mike Hale, New York TimesBecause for anyone thinking the genre was beginning to be played out, 'Masterpiece' has once again dug into its vault, and unearthed another gem. --Brian Lowry, VarietyPoldark Fills PBS's Downton Abbey Void --K.L. Connie Wang, Parade"] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.12 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Color, Widescreen, DVD Single, NTSC', 'Run time': '8 hours', 'Release date': 'July 7, 2015', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'PBS (Direct)', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Highly recommend this series Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/27 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Niall MacCormick'], 'Producers': ['Helen Gregory'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: It's no Downton Abbey - and a bit predictable at times, but it still was enjoyable to watch. Review Title: Four Stars Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/27 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bruce Goodison', 'Robert Quinn'], 'Producers': ['Rebecca Eaton', 'Francis Hopinkson', 'Catherine Oldfield', 'Sue de Beauvoir', 'Jeremy Gwilt'], 'Starring': ['Samantha Bond', 'Claire Calbraith', 'Claire Rushbrook'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} Review Text: well written and acted. Review Title: Four Stars Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The War Bride Review Date: 2016/08/30 Categories: Drama, Historical, Romance Product Description: ['English seamstress Lily (Anna Friel) marries and has a child with a Canadian soldier, but their new life is shattered when he ships out to fight in WWII. Shortly after, Lily and her newborn daughter are invited to come and live with his family in Canada, where conditions are not as splendid as he had described.'] Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Lyndon Chubbuck'], 'Producers': ['Douglas Berquist', 'Christopher Courtney', 'Torsten Leschly', 'Alistair MacLean-Clark', 'Jordan Randell', 'Molly Orr Rosenberg', 'Melvyn Singer', 'William Talmadge'], 'Starring': ['Anna Friel', 'Brenda Fricker', 'Molly Parker']} Review Text: I liked this movie - the pace was a little slow and the situations predictable, which I know doesn't sound like much of an endorsement, but it was extremely well acted and the slower pace helps to build the characters so you begin to care what happens to these people. If you like WWII movies give it a chance I don't think you will be disappointed. Review Title: I liked this movie - the pace was a little slow ... Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/08 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brett Haley'], 'Producers': ['Brett Haley', 'Rebecca Green', 'Laura D. Smith Ireland'], 'Starring': ['Blythe Danner', 'Martin Starr', 'June Squibb'], 'Studio': ['PREFERRED CONTENT']} Review Text: Wasn't a" great" movie but it was a pleasant diversion for an evening. Great cast, all of them playing the usual characters but they played off each other well. It is a little sad so be prepared. Review Title: Enjoyed it Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/27 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Nigel Stafford-Clark'], 'Producers': ['Nigel Stafford-Clark'], 'Starring': ['Gillian Anderson', 'Denis Lawson', 'Charles Dance']} Review Text: Quality Drama - a little slow but if you love the stories of Charles Dickens you will be satisfied. Shortly after, Lily and her newborn daughter are invited to come and live with his family in Canada, where conditions are not as splendid as he had described.'] Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Lyndon Chubbuck'], 'Producers': ['Douglas Berquist', 'Christopher Courtney', 'Torsten Leschly', 'Alistair MacLean-Clark', 'Jordan Randell', 'Molly Orr Rosenberg', 'Melvyn Singer', 'William Talmadge'], 'Starring': ['Anna Friel', 'Brenda Fricker', 'Molly Parker']} Review Text: I liked this movie - the pace was a little slow and the situations predictable, which I know doesn't sound like much of an endorsement, but it was extremely well acted and the slower pace helps to build the characters so you begin to care what happens to these people. If you like WWII movies give it a chance I don't think you will be disappointed. Review Title: I liked this movie - the pace was a little slow ... Review Title: Four Stars Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The shopping behavior reveals a strong preference for dramatic narratives, particularly those influenced by British literature and period pieces. Ratings consistently hover in the mid to high 4s, suggesting an overall satisfaction with quality and thematic depth. The individual enjoys films that evoke nostalgia and emotional resonance, evidenced by positive reactions to both classic and contemporary dramas.

Common themes across products include lighthearted romantic comedies and more serious narratives, hinting at a well-rounded taste. The viewer seems to respond favorably to stories with well-defined characters and emotional arcs, especially those dealing with familial relationships or personal growth.

Quality parameters indicate a preference for reputable studios, likely seeking assurance of good production values. However, the individual expresses sensitivity to product reliability, as indicated by disappointments related to defective media in certain purchases. Price appears secondary to quality as purchases span a range of cost but prioritize the experience over budget constraints.

Ultimately, core preferences center on carefully curated drama with emotional depth, quality production, and strong character development, balanced with a nostalgic appreciation for classic storytelling.

target_interaction.title: Arrived in expected time - quality of movie was good - a little jumpy during the opening credits but ...
target_interaction.text:
Arrived in expected time - quality of movie was good - a little jumpy during the opening credits but that actually may have been the original film.
Interesting to watch this story through modern eyes.
description: Academy Award winners Clark Gable and Sidney Poitier star with Yvonne DeCarlo in this story of an aristocratic young woman who falls from theheights of Southern society to the absolute bottom--and of the forbiddenlove that redeems her in A Band of Angels.New Orleans, 1860s. Southern Belle Amantha Starr is away atan exclusive girls' school when her father dies unexpectedly. She learnsshe is now penniless: Her father had lost everything--their money, theirplantation and their slaves. Worse, the truth comes out that her motherwas part African American--and under the law of Louisiana, Amantha mustbe sold into slavery. She is purchased by plantation owner Hamish Bond, who soon falls in love with his beautiful new slave--earningAmantha the resentment of overseer Rau Ru . When the UnitedStates' Civil War breaks out, Bond loses his plantation and reveals tothe newly freed Amantha that he yearned his fortune as a slave trader.
Sidney Poitier, in the beginning of his career, fires up the screen in the Civil-War-era bodice-ripper
. The movie follows Amantha Starr (Yvonne De Carlo, later on

), a Southern belle whose fortunes fall when her father dies and family secrets come to light. She ends up under the protection of Hamish Bond (Clark Gable, close to the end of his long, remarkable career and still radiating an easy, charismatic masculinity), a plantation owner with secrets of his own. For much of the movie, slavery and the Civil War are just a colorful backdrop for a turgid romance--but just when you're ready to write the movie off, a scene unexpectedly digs into something more emotionally and politically complex. Poitier plays Bond's plantation foreman; every time he appears,

turns into something fierce and promising. That promise never fully takes hold--Clark Gable is the movie's hero, not Poitier--but those crackling scenes (combined with a surprisingly sexual frankness in a 1957 feature) make
more than just an embarrassing collection of manly swaggers, flashing eyes, and lugubrious spirituals.
